text: best music of the series IMO. The third part of the game was kinda lackluster and overhyped (we all thought Lennus would look like Lennus but instead it had the same freaking palette the rest of the game did) and then BOOM Mouth Junior and this theme kicks in. Not as good as the first game but definitely more polished.
author: B.

text: SNES games had such good music! <3

author: Ryo hazuki

text:
what's even more annoying is that the second game is basically sequel bait. You get in the machine with Pedro, Midia and the other guy that was a scientist in the first game and you go to Raiga's homeworld.

Something goes wrong and then your whole team gets seperated and you plays as the scientist guy or something. Hell make it a scenario type of game like Rudra no Hihou...
author: B.

text: As a big fan of the original game, I'm glad an English translation was completed a couple years ago so I could play this sequel. It turned out to be one of my favorite RPGs for the SNES and for a console full of classics, that's very high praise. There's nothing quite like the Paladin's Quest series' strange worlds and atmosphere. This penultimate dungeon theme was quite powerful and memorable.
author: SupraDarky
